Overview.Summary: In the 2024 Moldovan presidential election, President Maia Sandu launched a campaign to promote an EU referendum (1). The country's pro-Western government hailed the election results, despite accusations of Russian meddling (7). Moldova's finance minister resigned to serve as vice president of the central bank (2,5). The EU Commission recommended opening membership talks with Ukraine and Moldova (4). In the context of the 2024 presidential election, Russia has been accused of buying votes and attempting to influence the outcome (8,9).

Timeline.Text: Moldovan President Maia Sandu accuses Russia of attempting to influence the upcoming local elections.
As Moldova holds local elections, concerns arise about potential Russian meddling and its impact on the upcoming 2024 presidential election.
Moldova holds local elections, with a focus on the impact of Russian involvement and the upcoming 2024 presidential election.
The Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe releases a statement on their preliminary findings and conclusions regarding Moldova's local elections.
The EU Commission recommends opening membership talks with Ukraine and Moldova, prompting Moldovan President Maia Sandu to express her country's commitment to joining the EU.
Moldovan President Maia Sandu launches a campaign to promote an EU referendum and her bid for a second term in the upcoming 2024 presidential election.
Moldovan Finance Minister Petru Rotaru resigns from government to serve as vice president of the country's central bank, a move that could potentially impact the upcoming 2024 presidential election.
Moldovan President Maia Sandu's dog bites visiting Austrian President Alexander Van der Bellen on the hand, causing a stir in the media.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Moldovan presidential election is set to take place on a date between February 29 and May 27 (1, 2, 6). Maia Sandu is the current president of Moldova, having been elected in 2020 (1, 2). The election is expected to reveal the country's stance on joining the EU and its relationship with Russia (2, 3, 7, 10). The issue of abortion may also play a role in the election (5).

Timeline.Text: The issue of abortion, a potential factor in the 2024 Moldovan presidential election, is highlighted in the US elections.
The 2024 Moldovan presidential election is one of the upcoming events listed in an overview of election dates for that year.
Moldova's Prime Minister appoints a new foreign minister to boost efforts towards joining the EU, a major issue in the upcoming presidential election.
The Moldovan president welcomes US sanctions on a pro-Russian party member, further emphasizing the divide between pro-Europe and pro-Russia factions in the country.
Maia Sandu, the current president of Moldova, is mentioned in an article about the upcoming presidential election.
The Moldovan parliament supports joining the EU, a major issue in the upcoming presidential election, but divisions within the country remain.
The Moldovan president discusses Moldova's role in Ukraine's economic recovery, highlighting the country's potential for growth and development under a pro-Europe leadership.
The presidential term of Volodymyr Zelensky, a key player in Moldova's relations with Ukraine, expires.
Twelve Moldovan parties form a pro-Europe pact, a significant development in the lead up to the presidential election.
Maia Sandu, the founder and former leader of the pro-Europe Party of Action and Solidarity, is inaugurated as the President of Moldova.

Overview.Summary: Moldova's 2024 presidential election is making headlines as current president Maia Sandu launches a campaign to promote an EU referendum (1). The race is also seeing significant fundraising efforts from candidates (2). In other political news, former vice president Joe Biden has officially dropped out of the 2024 race and endorsed Kamala Harris, prompting reactions from President Trump (3,7). Stress management strategies are being shared as the election approaches (5). In international news, Ukraine's foreign minister explains the country's relationship with Moldova's Transnistria region (6). On a lighter note, Moldova's president's dog caused a stir by biting the Austrian president during a visit (10).

Overview.Summary: Moldovan President Maia Sandu launched a campaign to promote an EU referendum (1,6). The current Finance Minister, Petru Rotaru, has accepted a new job at the Central Bank (2,3). However, Sandu rejected a regional leader due to his connections with a fugitive magnate (4,13). Sandu also welcomed US sanctions on a pro-Russian party member (5). The elections in Moldova are being closely watched for possible Russian meddling (10,15). The president's dog bit a visiting Austrian president (7). Experts warn of potential Russian propaganda in the lead-up to the 2024 presidential elections (8). Twelve parties have pledged to support EU membership for Moldova (9). The Central Electoral Commission has authorized opinion polls for the upcoming presidential elections (12). Sandu has accused Russia of "buying" voters in local elections (14,20). A former Prime Minister, Vasile Tarlev, has announced his candidacy for the presidential elections (19). Sandu has also hailed the adoption of a defense strategy citing Russia as a threat (18). President Joe Biden has dropped out of the 2024 presidential race (16).

Timeline.Text: Moldovan President Maia Sandu launches a campaign to promote an EU referendum, citing a historic opportunity for the country to push for EU membership.
Twelve Moldovan parties form a pact committing to push for EU membership, ahead of an October referendum.
Moldova's Socialists nominate a unified opposition candidate for the upcoming presidential election.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyj warns of increased Russian propaganda leading up to the 2024 presidential election.
US President Joe Biden announces that he will not run for re-election in 2024.
The Moldovan Central Electoral Commission authorizes the conducting of opinion polls on the upcoming presidential election.
Former Prime Minister Vasile Tarlev announces his candidacy for the upcoming presidential election.
Moldovan Finance Minister Petru Rotaru resigns to take a senior position at the central bank.
A poll predicts that Maia Sandu's party will not win the upcoming presidential election in the first round.
President Maia Sandu accuses Russia of trying to influence the local elections by funneling money to pro-Moscow parties.
Moldova holds parliamentary elections amidst suspected Russian meddling.
President Maia Sandu rejects a regional leader over their ties to a fugitive magnate.
President Maia Sandu hails the adoption of a new defense strategy, citing the need to counter Russian influence.
